components.description:
A scorpion, an arachnid with lobster-like pincers and a stinging tail. Depicted as a light-brown scorpion from above, often facing left, with its pincers and curving stinger raised. Shown with six or, accurately, eight legs in addition to its pincers.

Often used to represent ‚ôè Scorpio in the Western zodiac.

WhatsApp’s scorpion is reddish in color.
components.title: Scorpion

Often used to represent ‚ôè Scorpio in the Western zodiac.

title: Scorpion

version.description: The Unicode Consortium has approved the following 41 emoji characters as part of Unicode 8.0, released on June 17, 2015. This is comprised of 37 new emojis, plus five emoji modifiers. Find out more about this update on the Emojipedia Blog.

emoji_net_data.category: Supplemental Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A scorpion shown with eight legs and an upright rail. May also be used in relation to the zodiac sign Scorpius. Scorpion was approved as par http://emojipedia.org/scorpion/
emoji_net_data.name: scorpion

bn:13679442a: Of, or pertaining to, the Scorpio star sign

bn:00004222n: Animals are multicellular, eukaryotic organisms of the kingdom Animalia.
Creature is a 1999 documentary film that was directed by Parris Patton.
All of the animal life of any particular region or time.

Any living organism characterized by voluntary movement, the possession of cells with noncellulose cell walls and specialized sense organs enabling rapid response to stimuli, and the ingestion of complex organic substances such as plants and other animals.
A living organism characterized by voluntary movement
A living organism characterized by voluntary movement.
Animals considered as a group; especially those of a particular country, region, time, etc.
Any of various processes, either sexual or asexual, by which an animal produces one or more individuals similar to itself.
The entire animal life of a given region, habitat or geological stratum.
Any nonhuman animal, esp. a large, four-footed mammal.
Fauna is all of the animal life of any particular region or time.
This page is for quotes about animals.

bn:00082066n: Celestial circle of twelve divisions centered upon the ecliptic
A belt-shaped region in the heavens on either side to the ecliptic; divided into 12 constellations or signs for astrological purposes.
A belt-shaped region in the heavens on either side to the ecliptic; divided into 12 constellations or signs for astrological purposes

In both astrology and historical astronomy, the zodiac is a circle of twelve 30 ¬∞ divisions of celestial longitude that are centered upon the ecliptic: the apparent path of the Sun across the celestial sphere over the course of the year.
The belt-like region of the celestial sphere corresponding to the apparent path of the sun over the course of a year, the ecliptic.

bn:00069766n: Scorpius, sometimes known as Scorpio, is one of the constellations of the zodiac.
Eighth astrological sign in the zodiac
Scorpio is the eighth astrological sign in the Zodiac.
One of the twelve constellations of the zodiac.
A large zodiacal constellation between Libra and Sagittarius

bn:00005282n: Arachnids is a class of joint-legged invertebrate animals in the subphylum Chelicerata.
Any of the eight-legged creatures, including spiders and scorpions, of the class Arachnida.
Any of the eight-legged creatures, including spiders and scorpions, of the class Arachnida
Air-breathing arthropods characterized by simple eyes and four pairs of legs
A class of eight-legged creatures in the subphylum Chelicerata.

bn:00069769n: Scorpions are predatory arthropod animals of the order Scorpiones within the class Arachnida.
Arachnid of warm dry regions having a long segmented tail ending in a venomous stinger
Any of various arachnids of the order Scorpiones.
An arthropod with eight legs, belonging to the order Scorpiones in the class Arachnida.
An animal of the order Scorpiones within the class Arachnida
Any of various arachnids of the order Scorpiones, related to the spiders, characterised by two large front pincers and a curved tail with a poisonous sting in the end.
